item.title: Computational Models for Human Inference of Social Situations
item.description: Aimed to characterize the nature and granularity of information about social interactions accessible to human observers from simple visual displays. Studied lay theories of human emotion modelling and developed a computational model for social situations involving few agents, based on the Valence Arousal Model of emotion detection and the Social Force Model for Pedestrian Dynamics

item.title: Attention Based Models for Image Captioning and Generation
item.description: Studied the theory of encoder decoder sequence models, soft attention and hard attention and reproduced the results in Show Attend and Tell : Neural Image Caption Generation with Visual Attention

item.title: Case Studies : A Legal Consultant Bot
item.description: Developed a legal consultant bot that summarises a legal document, highlights the key phrases and answers some rudimentary questions about the document as part of the Microsoft code.fun.do Hackathon on AI and NLP. Created a custom dataset by scrapinng from an archive of Indian legal documents, and Used TextRank Algorithm on the large text corpora and Latent Dirichlet Allocation for topic modelling. Selected as one of the top 3 ideas on campus by Microsoft Judges
